alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 21 at 3:20AM PST until December 23 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to four tenths of an inch possible. Locally higher snow amounts above 5000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph, except 60 to 70 mph above treeline. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday afternoon commute and the Friday morning commute. Cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
